content: We found <1>{{users}} users</1> without emails. You can fill their emails or continue without this action.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message about users without emails who have not had their email addresses filled in. It will be displayed as a notification or alert when data is being imported into a system that requires email addresses for all users.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You can fill their emails' is translated as 'يمكنك إضافة البريد الإلكتروني الخاصة بهم'. While technically correct, a more natural and idiomatic translation would be 'يمكنك إدخال بريدهم الإلكتروني' or 'يمكنك إدخال عنوان بريدهم الإلكتروني'. The current phrasing implies adding emails *to* them, rather than adding *their* emails.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: يمكنك إدخال بريدهم الإلكتروني

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation maintains the angle brackets `<1>{{users}}</1>` from the English, which isn't standard practice in Arabic UI text.  It's cleaner to remove these or adapt the formatting to be more suitable for Arabic text direction (right-to-left).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: وجدنا {{users}} مستخدمين بدون بريد الكتروني. يمكنك إضافة البريد الإلكتروني الخاصة بهم أو المتابعة دون هذا الإجراء.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The opening tag `<1>` and closing tag `</1>` are inconsistent with English. In English, it's `<1>{{users}}</1>`. The Azerbaijani version has `<1>{{users}}</1>`. This could cause rendering issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change the Azerbaijani tag to `<1>{{users}}</1>` to match the English structure.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'E-poçt ünvanı olmayan' is a bit wordy. A more natural phrasing for 'without emails' would be something like 'e-poçtü olmayan' or 'e-poçtü yox olan'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'e-poçtü olmayan' or 'e-poçtü yox olan' for a more natural flow.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The XML tags <1> and </1> are not consistently translated. The word 'Benutzer' is inside the opening tag but nothing else is.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent translation within the XML tags. Consider translating the tags themselves, or removing the tags altogether if they are purely structural.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English word 'emails' is translated as 'E-Mails'. While understandable, the more common and preferred translation would be 'E-Mail-Adressen'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'E-Mails' to 'E-Mail-Adressen'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You can fill their emails' is an awkward translation. 'Fill their emails' doesn't directly translate to how a user would typically interact with this function. A more natural phrasing would be 'You can add their emails' or 'You can enter their emails'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Puede completar sus correos electrónicos -> Puede añadir sus correos electrónicos / Puede ingresar sus correos electrónicos

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The trailing space after 'käyttäjää' is unnecessary and impacts readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Löysimme <1>{{users}} käyttäjää</1> ilman sähköposteja. Voit lisätä heidän sähköpostinsa tai jatkaa lisäämättä.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'sans avoir les ajouter' is grammatically incorrect. It should describe the action of adding the email addresses.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: sans les ajouter

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ajouter leurs adresses e-mail' is not the best translation for 'fill their emails'. A more accurate translation would convey the action of completing/providing missing email addresses.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: compléter leurs adresses e-mail

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'users' is translated as 'օգտվողներ', which is correct. However, the phrase 'without emails' is translated as 'առանց էլփոստի'.  A more natural and accurate translation would be 'առանց էլեկտրոնային փոստի' or 'առանց էլ․ փոստի'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Մենք գտանք <1>{{users}} օգտվողներ</1> առանց էլեկտրոնային փոստի:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You can fill their emails' is translated as 'Դուք կարող եք լրացնել նրանց նամակները'. 'Նամակները' (letters) is not quite right. It should be 'էլ․ հասցեները' (email addresses) or 'էլ․ փոստերը'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Մենք գտանք <1>{{users}} օգտվողներ</1> առանց էլեկտրոնային փոստի: Դուք կարող եք լրացնել նրանց էլ․ հասցեները կամ շարունակել առանց այս գործողության:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "aggiungere le loro email" is not the best translation for "fill their emails". It literally translates to 'add their emails'. A more natural translation would be 'compilare le loro email' or 'inserire le loro email'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Abbiamo trovato <1>{{users}} utenti</1> senza email. Puoi compilare le loro email o saltare questa azione.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "メールアドレスのない" (meeru adoresu no nai) is a bit stiff and unnatural. A more natural way to say 'without emails' would be something like 'メールアドレスが設定されていない' (meeru adoresu ga settingu sarete inai) or 'メールアドレスがない' (meeru adoresu ga nai).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: メールアドレスが設定されていない<1>{{users}}ユーザー</1>が見つかりました。メールアドレスを入力するか、このアクションを実行せずに続行することができます。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag `<1>` is not a standard tag and seems misplaced. It's assumed to be a placeholder. Standard placeholders for translations should be placed inside the `{{...}}` tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: メールアドレスが設定されていない{{users}}ユーザーが見つかりました。メールアドレスを入力するか、このアクションを実行せずに続行することができます。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "이해당 사용자의 메일을 입력하거나" is awkward and doesn't accurately convey "You can fill their emails". A more natural Korean translation would be something like "사용자의 이메일을 입력하거나" or "사용자에게 이메일을 입력하거나".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 사용자의 이메일을 입력하거나

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle bracket placement is inconsistent with the English source. The English source has <1> and </1>. The Korean translation has <1>{{users}}</1>. It should be <1>{{users}}</1> to match.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change </1> to </1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ສືບຕໍ່ໂດຍບໍ່ມີການດໍາເນີນການນີ້" is awkward and doesn't directly translate to 'continue without this action'. It implies a more formal process than the English conveys. A more natural translation would be something like 'ສືບຕໍ່ໂດຍບໍ່ຕ້ອງເຮັດຫຍັງ'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ພວກເຮົາພົບເຫັນ <1>{{users}} ຜູ້ໃຊ້</1> ໂດຍບໍ່ມີອີເມວ. ທ່ານສາມາດຕື່ມຂໍ້ມູນໃສ່ອີເມວຂອງເຂົາເຈົ້າຫຼືສືບຕໍ່ໂດຍບໍ່ຕ້ອງເຮັດຫຍັງ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "bez e-pasta ziņojumiem" (without email messages) is a literal translation that doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of 'without emails'. A more natural translation would be 'bez e-pastiem'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Mēs atradām <1>{{users}} lietotājus</1> bez e-pastiem.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'fill' (invullen) doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'add' or 'provide'. It implies a process of filling in a blank, which isn't precisely what's happening with email addresses.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: We hebben <1>{{users}} gebruikers</1> zonder e-mailadressen gevonden. U kunt hun e-mailadressen toevoegen of doorgaan zonder deze actie.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation retains the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>`, which should ideally be removed or handled appropriately within the application displaying the text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove or sanitize the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` from the translated string.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While understandable, the phrase 'dodać ich adresy e-mail' is a bit clunky. A more natural Polish phrasing would be 'wypełnić ich adresy e-mail' or 'wprowadzić ich adresy e-mail'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'dodać ich adresy e-mail' to 'wypełnić ich adresy e-mail' or 'wprowadzić ich adresy e-mail'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "sem e-mails" is a literal translation of "without emails" and sounds slightly unnatural in Portuguese. A more natural phrasing would be "sem endereço de e-mail" or simply "sem e-mail".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Encontramos <1>{{users}} usuários</1> sem endereço de e-mail. Você pode preencher seus e-mails ou continuar sem esta ação.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'seus' (their) referring to emails is slightly awkward. It's understood, but a more natural way to say it would be 'preencher os e-mails' (fill the emails).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Encontramos <1>{{users}} usuários</1> sem endereço de e-mail. Você pode preencher os e-mails ou continuar sem esta ação.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You can fill their emails' is not a natural or idiomatic translation. A better phrasing would reflect 'You can add their email addresses'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Você pode adicionar seus endereços de e-mail

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The closing tag '</1>' is misplaced and doesn't align with the opening tag '<1>{{users}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Correct the closing tag to '</1>'. It should be consistently applied.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'fără adrese de e-mail' is slightly awkward. While grammatically correct, it could be improved for flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to 'fără e-mail' or 'fără adresă de e-mail'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'acțiune' in 'fără acestă acțiune' might be better phrased. Using just 'fără aceasta' would be more concise and natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'fără acestă acțiune' to 'fără aceasta'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are not properly closed in the Russian translation, mirroring the English but potentially causing rendering issues. They should be `<1>` and `</1>`.

The word 'පරිශ්‍රීලකයින්' (parishreelayakayin) is a somewhat formal and less common way to say 'users'. A more natural and common translation would be 'වියත්කරුවන්' (viyathkaruwen) or simply 'භාවිතකරුවන්' (bhavitakaruwen).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'පරිශ්‍රීලකයින්' with 'වියත්කරුවන්' or 'භාවිතකරුවන්'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'වි-තැපෑලක් රහිත' (vi-tapaelak rahita) is a somewhat literal translation of 'without emails'. While understandable, a more natural phrasing in Sinhala would be 'තැපැල් ලිපිනය රහිත' (tapael lipinaya rahita) or 'තැපැල් ලිපිනයක් නොමැති' (tapael lipinayak novamati).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'වි-තැපෑලක් රහිත' with 'තැපැල් ලිපිනය රහිත' or 'තැපැල් ලිපිනයක් නොමැති'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "kde nie je uvedený e-mail" is a literal translation that doesn't convey the meaning of 'without emails' as clearly as possible.  A more natural Slovak phrasing would be something like 'bez e-mailových adries' or 'ktorí nemajú e-mail'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Našli sme <1>{{users}} používateľov </1>, ktorí nemajú e-mail.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The closing bracket <1> isn't aligned with the opening bracket. It's placed directly after the number of users, which makes the sentence awkward to read.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Našli sme <1>{{users}} používateľov</1>, ktorí nemajú e-mail. Môžete doplniť ich e-maily alebo pokračovať ďalej.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'e-mail' is often written as 'e-pošta' in Slovenian, which is more common and reflects standard terminology.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Našli smo <1>{{users}} uporabnikov</1> brez e-pošte.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'lahko izpolnite' is grammatically correct, 'lahko vnesete' might be a slightly more natural and fluent wording when referring to entering email addresses.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Našli smo <1>{{users}} uporabnikov</1> brez e-pošte. Lahko vnesete njihove e-poštne naslove ali nadaljujete brez tega dejanja.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'емаил-ова' is a direct transliteration of 'emails' and isn't the most natural or accurate translation in Serbian. A better option would be 'е-маил адреса' or simply 'е-маил'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Пронашли смо <1>{{users}} корисника</1> без е-маил адреса.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'попунити' is a bit formal for this context. A more conversational and natural word would be 'унети'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Можете унети њихове е-маил адресе или наставити без ове радње.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are inconsistent with the English content. The English uses `<1>` and `</1>`, while the Serbian uses `<1>` and `</1>`.
The word 'radnje' (action) is a bit awkward in this context. It's a more formal term than necessary and doesn't flow naturally.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more casual word like 'tako' (so) or rephrasing the sentence to something like 'Možete popuniti njihove email-ove ili nastaviti dalje.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "E-postaları olmayan <1>{{users}} kullanıcılar</1> bulduk" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "We found <1>{{users}} users</1> without emails."  A better translation would convey that the users *lack* emails rather than that emails are 'missing' from the users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bulduğumuz <1>{{users}} kullanıcıların e-posta adresleri yok.</1> or <1>{{users}} kullanıcı, e-posta adresi olmayanlar</1> bulduk.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>{{users}}</1>` tag formatting is inconsistent with the English tag `<1>{{users}}</1>`. While not a critical error, consistency is preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Keep the formatting as `<1>{{users}}</1>` to match the English source.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Ukrainian versions. While technically not an error, consistency is important. The surrounding text should also be verified for proper HTML structure within the larger context of the application.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the application's HTML structure and ensure the <1> and </1> tags are used consistently and correctly. Consider whether these are placeholders or intended to be part of the visible text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "không có email" is a literal translation of "without emails". A more natural and idiomatic Vietnamese translation would be "chưa có email" (not yet have email) or "thiếu email" (lacking email).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Chúng tôi đã tìm thấy <1>{{users}} người dùng</1> chưa có email. or Chúng tôi đã tìm thấy <1>{{users}} người dùng</1> thiếu email.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "没有电子邮件" (méiyǒu diànzǐ yóu jiàn) translates to "without email" or "no email". While technically correct, a more natural and common way to say this in Chinese would be "没有邮箱" (méiyǒu yóuxiāng) which means 'no email address'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "没有电子邮件" to "没有邮箱".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Chinese translation maintains the `<1>` and `</1>` tags which were present in the English content. These tags likely represent HTML or a similar templating structure. It's important to confirm whether these tags should be retained in the Chinese version and if so, if the placement is correct.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify that the `<1>` and `</1>` tags are necessary and correctly placed in the Chinese translation. If they are not needed, remove them.
